requirement.title: 3 Inputs
requirement.description: The program will read in 3 inputs -  numbers representing the 3 sides of a triangle.

requirement.title: Input Range
requirement.description: The 3 inputs shall be numbers, greater than 0, and no larger than the system's maximum floating point number.

requirement.title: Handle Invalid Input
requirement.description: If invalid input is entered, the program shall print an error message and quit.

requirement.title: Accept Decimals
requirement.description: Decimals shall be an acceptable number format.

requirement.title: Accept Integers
requirement.description: Integers shall be an acceptable number format.

requirement.title: Scientific Notation
requirement.description: Scientific notation shall be an acceptable number format.

requirement.title: Legal Triangle
requirement.description:
The program shall verify that the sides form a legal triangle: 

In a legal triangle, for any 3 sides x, y, z where x<=y<=z, then x+y > z.

requirement.title: Handle Illegal Triangles
requirement.description: If it is not a legal triangle, the program shall print an error message and quit.

requirement.title: Isoceles Triangle
requirement.description: If two sides are equal, but not three, the program shall report the triangle as "isosceles."

requirement.title: Equilateral Triangle
requirement.description: If the sides are all equal, the program shall report the triangle as "Equilateral."

requirement.title: Scalene Trianlge
requirement.description: If none of the sides are equal, the program shall report the triangle as "scalene."

requirement.title: Right Triangle Reporting
requirement.description:
For right triangles, the program will report that they are right triangles.

In a right triangle, for any 3 sides x, y, z where x<=y<=z, then x^2 + y^2 = z^2.

Applies only to isosceles and scalene triangles as by definition equaliteral triangles cannot be right triangles.

requirement.title: Very Large Triangles
requirement.description: The program shall support very large triangles (sides larger than sqrt(max float)) by stating that right triangle-ness is indeterminate unless it is an equilateral triangle.
